citation.article-title: Alkanindiges hongkongensis sp. nov. A novel Alkanindiges species isolated from a patient with parotid abscess

p.s: Description of A. hongkongensis sp. nov.
A. hongkongensis (hong.kong.en'sis. N.L. fem. adj. hongkongensis of Hong Kong, where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are aerobic, non-sporulating, Gram-negative but difficult to be destained, coccobacilli.
It grows on sheep blood agar as non-hemolytic colonies of 0.5 mm in diameter after 24 h of incubation at 37 °C in ambient air.
Growth also occurs on MacConkey agar and Muller–Hinton agar supplemented with 10% (v/v) Tween 80, at 25 and 30 °C, but not on Muller–Hinton agar or at 4, 42, 44, and 50 °C.
No enhancement of growth is observed in 5% CO2.
The organism is aflagellated, and is non-motile at both 25 and 37 °C.
It is catalase positive but oxidase negative.
It does not ferment, oxidize, or assimilate any sugar tested.
The moles percent G+C content of the DNA of the strain is 46.9±4.3%.
The organism was isolated from the pus of a parotid gland abscess in a patient with Warthin's tumor.
The type strain of A. hongkongensis is strain HKU9T.
Its 16S rRNA gene sequences have been lodged within the GenBank sequence database under accession nos. AF543466, AY251390, and AY251391.
